required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Painless Myocardial Ischemia in Diabetic Patients.
clinical_study.official_title: Changes of Plasma Orphanin and Norepinephrine Levels in Patients With Painless Myocardial Ischemia and Diabetes Mellitus.

lead_sponsor.agency: Second Hospital of Shanxi Medical University

clinical_study.source: Second Hospital of Shanxi Medical University

brief_summary.textblock: This study aims to investigate the relationship between the concentrations of blood orphanin, norepinephrine and the morbidity of painless myocardial ischemia in patients with diabetes mellitus. Hopefully, the biomarker(s) in the blood of diabetic patients can be found for screening high risk patients in the diabetes sufferers to prevent the painless myocardial ischemia.

primary_outcome.description: Blood orphanin levels in painless diabetic patients with myocardial ischemia requiring interventional therapy and diabetic patients without interventional therapy.
Blood norepinephrine levels in diabetic patients with painless myocardial ischemia requiring interventional therapy and diabetic patients without interventional therapy

arm_group.description: In diabetic patients without symptoms of myocardial ischemia, coronary angiography showed no stenosis or stenosis less than 75%.
Coronary angiographic stenosis was more than 75% in diabetic patients without myocardial ischemia symptoms, and coronary stents were implanted.

intervention.description: The levels of orphanin and norepinephrine in blood of diabetic patients with painless myocardial ischemia requiring interventional therapy and diabetic patients without interventional therapy were measured.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subject has diabetes
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of myocardial ischemia
- Symptoms of myocardial ischemia（ECG changes except）

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Second Hospital of Shanxi Medical University

patient_data.ipd_description: All IPD that underlie results in a publication
